headline: Top 5 AI Based Question Generation Platforms in EdTech Industry
name: Top 5 AI Based Question Generation Platforms in EdTech Industry
articleBody: Here are the top 5 AI-based question generation platforms in the industry.Artificial intelligence and machine learning are fast becoming a part of the educational sector. In the global educational market, AI is estimated to reach US$3.68 billion by 2023 at a CAGR of 47%..Teachers, students, and the administration teams will benefit from using AI in their institutions. Be it automating repeated tasks, planning customized online classes, or creating tests and analyzing results, AI software can help educational institutions to-.Save time, money, and effortReduce human bias and errorImprove the quality of teachingHelp students understand betterCustomize training modulesAutomate repetitive tasksCreating a virtual environment for improved concentrationEliminating geographical barriersProviding educational support within and outside the classroom.AI in EdTech .Artificial intelligence will soon become a deciding factor in EdTech. Educational institutions will need to prove themselves by adopting the latest AI technology and providing the staff, teachers, and students with the best possible environment to work and learn..Instant Learning .The Covid-19 pandemic has forced schools, colleges, and parents to adopt digital education. While online classes are still not AI-based, we've seen a rise in demand for platforms like Byju's where the modules are developed based on each student's needs..Students don't have to wait for a class to start or worry about missing a session. They can ask questions, get help from the virtual teacher as well as the real teacher (human). Step-by-step explanations are provided for each topic so that students easily understand the concepts..Digital Curriculum .The aim of using artificial intelligence in EdTech is to make students' experience the center of focus. Teach students what they are likely to enjoy; this is something Coursera has adopted in its own way. The AI-based online platform has a feature called CourseMatch..This tool helps students match their campus curriculum with the courses offered by the platform. CourseMatch is a machine learning algorithm that uses NLP (Natural Language Processing) to align the online courses with the ones the student has in their on-campus curriculum..Personalized Learning Modules .Personalization is the biggest gift given by artificial intelligence. The EdTech sector also is making the most of this aspect. Teachers don't have the time to plan personalized courses and teaching methods for each student in their class. But AI can help them achieve this..Both teachers and students benefit from personalized learning modules. Since students learn what they like in a way that's convenient to them, they are more likely to be attentive and score well. Teachers can ensure that all their students understand the concepts. Personalized learning also helps reduce aggressive behavior in students that stems from the frustration of feeling helpless in the classrooms..Chatbots .Chatbots are used to encourage students, give immediate feedback, and answer basic questions related to the subject. Cognii is a San Francisco-based EdTech tool that interacts with students. It shares feedback after the assessments, encourages them when they give the right answer, and offers personalized tutoring..These chatbots can take the pressure of the teachers by monitoring each student's learning with the same level of focus. Teachers can oversee the process and intervene when necessary, and students feel happy for the immediate feedback they get from the chatbot..Automatic Question and Answer Generation Using NLP .AI-based question generation platforms use NLP to process input data and deliver a set of questions as output. These tools are used by schools, colleges, tutorials, coaching centers, HR teams, and even government agencies for testing students and trainees..Steps Involved in the Implementation Process .Inputting Text: The platform accepts input in several forms such as text, image, files, video, etc., (though it depends on how the software has been designed)..Pre-processing: The text is analyzed using ANN (Artificial Neural Networks) to convert it into a set of questions (MCQs, fillups, matching, descriptive, etc.)..Forming Questions: The questions are presented on the screen for the user to determine the difficulty level or make further changes..Delivering Output: Once the test paper is finalized, the output is exported in multiple formats such as PDF, CSV files, etc. (this again depends on how the software has been developed)..Top AI-Based Question Generation Platforms in EdTech Industry .Let's explore the benefits of AI in the EdTech industry. Here are the leading platforms that generate question papers & tests using AI technology..1. PrepAI.PrepAI is a test generation platform that uses artificial intelligence to prepare test questions on behalf of teachers. It has a user-friendly interface and accepts inputs in the form of PDF files, MS Word documents, video URLs, video files, and content from Wikipedia. PrepAI is the only test generation platform that offers this feature of scraping content directly from Wikipedia..The platform is capable of preparing the type of questions in varying formats like-.Multiple Choice Questions (with single and multiple correct answers)Fill in the BlanksDescriptive QuestionsTrue or FalseStatement Based Questions.Teachers can choose between three difficulty levels (Easy, Medium, & Hard) and get the output in multiple formats. The global knowledge base of PrepAI ensures that teachers can create a test paper on any subject and any topic. Moreover, teachers can customize the questions, rate them, and rearrange them as required. PrepAI has been developed by DataToBiz and is one of the top AI question generation platforms in the market, and is available as a free version. The platform has been designed to help EdTech professionals, test authors, examination administrators, teachers, and tutors..Watch Demo: https://youtu.be/0dYOczvWPAo.2. Lumos Learning.Lumos Learning helps create assessments and test papers using machine learning. The platform converts statements and answers into questions instantly. It has been designed for schools (from elementary to high school), parents, and librarians to-.Align learning standardsAuto-generate remedial assignmentsImprove students' writing skillsConduct reading programsImprove subject/ grade-wise skills.The platform essentially creates test papers for mathematics, language and grammar, and reading comprehension. The Lumos tedBookTM has been designed to comply with the Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium (SBAC) standards. Teachers can access the test metrics to analyze students' performance and help them become proficient in each subject..Parents can use the platform to assess their children's performance and create workbooks to train them to do better academically. You can export the test papers in CSV format. It accepts input only through copy-pasting in the text box on the website..Watch Demo: https://youtu.be/kbCYfmcBuE4.3. Quillionz.Quillionz uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to build an array of question papers with the utmost ease. Teachers can customize the assessments and make the necessary changes to create a test as per their requirements..The platform creates-Multiple Choice QuestionsRecall QuestionsShort Descriptive Questions.The platform has a free and subscription version to generate questions whenever necessary. Quillionz has been developed by Harbinger AI and has a unique automated question generator to prepare test papers, quizzes, and notes for teachers and students. Schools and educational institutions can make use of the Quillionz API to integrate it with their existing systems..However, the platform currently accepts only PDF files, YouTube URL (when transcripts are available),.or direct copy-pasting of the text as input methods. Quillionz is also not suitable for highly technical content such as legal or medical articles/ test papers..Watch Demo: https://youtu.be/CPsxIIlVUHo.4. Questgen.Questgen uses advanced AI technologies like GPT-3 and natural language processing to create test questions for schools, HR teams, publishers, and EdTech companies. It can create several questions from the input blocks of text..Multiple Choice QuestionsMatch the FollowingTrue or False Questions, etc..You can create any of these using Questgen. The output can be exported in PDF format or as plain text. It takes just one click to generate the test questions using this platform. The input can be provided by copy-pasting the content in the text box. Questgen's open-source library is available on Github for developers. However, the Questgen tool is far more accurate to use..The platform offers a free trial option with a limited input word count to create tests and quizzes. Contact the support team for more information about the platform and its paid versions..Watch Demo: https://youtu.be/uvdCOuLAXqc.5. Questo.Questo is an AI-powered question generator platform designed to help students, educators, teachers, and tutors create test papers for any given material. The platform accepts text and images as inputs, reads the content, and produces a set of questions..Simple and easy to useFast resultsSuitable for students.The best feature of Questo is its automated revision scheduling that reminds students to focus more on topics and concepts that are hard to understand. All they need to do is take a picture of the textbook or study material and upload it to the platform. Questo will do the rest and produce a list of questions. The Beta version is now available for trial..Conclusion .Artificial intelligence is assisting teachers and administrators to streamline their work and complete it in lesser time without compromising on the quality. AI helps teachers create a one-to-one personal connection with students and design modules that match the understanding levels of every student..The AI-powered test generation platforms help in creating and customizing assessments to save time and energy for educators and teachers..Teachers and educators have enough time to update their knowledge and empower students by increasing their comprehension abilities. Artificial intelligence will soon become an intrinsic part of the EdTech industry..Disclaimer: Analytics Insight does not provide financial advice or guidance. Also note that the cryptocurrencies mentioned/listed on the website could potentially be scams, i.e. designed to induce you to invest financial resources that may be lost forever and not be recoverable once investments are made.
